Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Cylindrical vase with wide mouth, pointed rim and straight walls with a sharp curvature in the bottom part. The base is more or less stable with a marked ring-shaped foot. Orangey-coloured paste. The surface is covered with a light-coloured coating. The exterior rim shows a painted decoration consisting of a wide stripe of a reddish colour, framed by two lines in black.
